alert.note: Alert for Valley (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 20 at 10:59AM MDT until April 26 at 6:41PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River at Glasgow affecting Valley County. For the Milk River...including Saco, Tampico, Malta, Dodson, Glasgow, Nashua...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Milk River at Glasgow. * WHEN...Until Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, Storm drainage valves along Glasgow levee will back-flood into the southside of Glasgow if not closed. Flooding begins on Rahlf Lane off of Highway 24. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM MDT Thursday the stage was 30.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM MDT Thursday was 30.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late Tuesday morning and continue falling to 19.2 feet Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 30.4 feet on 05/24/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening by 1100 PM MDT.
